channel.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
channel.description:
Hello ~
How do I add exceptions to the ::pickup command ? I do not mean "&& (playerRights >= 2))"
I mean like, when you try to spawn dragon claws for example, you get the error "You cant spawn these, buy them instead." For example..
How do I add this ?
Im not a good coder so please include the whole pickup part. Thank you :)

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @V1LL3 V1LL3
item.description:
@V1LL3 wrote:

My way didnt work

So I thought off the best way;
removing thw whole pickup command !

[quote=“V1LL3, post:3, topic:320716”]Im not a coder, but I dont think that would work for me…

I want, like, if you have played Project Catastrophe, a pickup server, but they have special items, credit items, that cant be spawned…
So, I guess it would have to contain the ids, in this case 10003 & 10004 …[/quote]Add methods for the items that you don’t want people to be able to spawn.

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“V1LL3, post:24, topic:320716”]I acctually got it to work, with no errors in compiler !
Except that I get it anyway…

The eaiest way is often the best:
I used the little knowledge of coding I had.
(<=, => == and such)
And added this:
if (newItemID == 10004);
sendMessage (“You can’t spawn this item.”);

And it worked, still except that it adds the item anyway …[/quote]

They are called operators, and anyways, you bascially took mine, which works so don’t get to happy.

item.source: How do I add a exception in a command?

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:21, topic:320716”][quote author=relmitos link=topic=417183.msg3071653#msg3071653 date=1261571374]
Client class.
[/quote]

No, don’t declare anything. The itemPicked variable should be in your ‘pickup’ command…like so:

if(command.startsWith("pickup")) { try { int itemID = command.substring(Integer.parseInt(7, 12)); int amount = command.substring(Integer.parseInt(13)); if (isUnspawnable(itemID)) { sendMessage("You cannot spawn this item, buy it in the store!"); return; } else addItem(itemID, amount); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("You need 5 chars when entering an item ID."); } }

Just replace your ‘pickup’ command with that and you should be fine.[/quote]

exactly what i said, but w\e.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

relmitos:

Client class.

No, don’t declare anything. The itemPicked variable should be in your ‘pickup’ command…like so:

if(command.startsWith("pickup")) { try { int itemID = command.substring(Integer.parseInt(7, 12)); int amount = command.substring(Integer.parseInt(13)); if (isUnspawnable(itemID)) { sendMessage("You cannot spawn this item, buy it in the store!"); return; } else addItem(itemID, amount); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("You need 5 chars when entering an item ID."); } }

Just replace your ‘pickup’ command with that and you should be fine.

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @V1LL3 V1LL3
item.description:
@V1LL3 wrote:

I get the error:
client.java:11912: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable itemPicked
location: class client
[tab] if (isUnspawnable(itemPicked)) {
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprection for details.
1 error
Finished!
Tryck på en valfri tangent för att fortsätta… (Press any key to continue…)

Oh, and yeah, when I first tried, I got the error
Symbol ) expected
[tab] if (isUnspawnable(itemPicked) {
^
If you wonder why it is )) in it…
Please help, im using a 317 server, Project Sapphire by l3itcher…
I like it, it has cfg files, so I can add and remove npcs and objects…

Read full topic

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

This…

public int unspawnable[] = {ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID etc...};


public boolean isUnspawnable(int item) {
	for(int i = 0; i < unspawnable.length; i++) {
		if(unspawnable[i] == item) {
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID == ITEMID){ sM("You can't spawn this item."); } else if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("That Item Doesn't Exist"); } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! "); } }

change this to delta or w\e your source is if you need.

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

Something I prefer to do is use arrays in this kind of stuff, incase you were to ever make alot of items unspawnable.

to do it this way:

Declare:

[code] int unspawnable[] = {ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID, ITEMID etc…};

boolean isUnspawnable(int item) {
	for(int i = 0; i < unspawnable.length; i++) {
		if(unspawnable[i] == item) {
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}[/code]

Replace ITEMID with the item ids, of course.

and in your pickup command, add this:

if (isUnspawnable(itemPicked)) { sendMessage("You cannot spawn this item, buy it in the store!"); return; }

Read full topic
item.source: How do I add a exception in a command?

item.title: How do I add a exception in a command?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

That’s what the “if(!itemPicked == …)” condition is for The ! will check if it does not equal the given conditions.

Use it like this: if(!itemPicked == 10003 || !itemPicked == 10004){

Read full topic
